summary: This is an email exchange between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation. The FBI agent provides an address list and relays information from a counselor (Twiler) about Randy, who reports that Edwards is contacting victims and encouraging them that Epstein's 18-month sentence is insufficient.

persons.name: Twiler
persons.context: Relayed information to the FBI agent about Randy's reports regarding Edwards contacting victims.

persons.name: Randy
persons.context: Reported to Twiler that Edwards has been talking to victims she is counseling about Epstein's sentence.

persons.name: Edwards
persons.context: Reportedly talking to victims counseled by Randy and encouraging them that Epstein's 18-month sentence is not long enough.

persons.name: Miler
persons.context: Suggested by the FBI agent as someone the AUSA might want to speak to directly regarding the information about Edwards and the victims.

connections.description: Twiler received information from Randy about Edwards contacting victims.
Randy reported that Edwards was contacting victims she was counseling.
Edwards was reportedly encouraging victims that Epstein's 18-month sentence was insufficient.

events.title: Email exchange about victim contacts
events.description: FBI agent emails AUSA with address list and reports that Edwards is contacting victims counseled by Randy, encouraging them that Epstein's 18-month sentence is not long enough.

keyFacts: An FBI agent provided an updated address list to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in July 2008.
Counselor Randy reported that an individual named Edwards was contacting victims she counseled regarding the Epstein case.
Edwards was allegedly encouraging victims that the proposed 18-month sentence for Epstein was insufficient.
The email suggests ongoing communication and concern about victim outreach and sentiment during the plea negotiation phase.
